name: Premier Inn Heathrow Airport Terminal 5

reviews.text: Had an enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Positive stay but family rooms rather small

reviews.text: Reception, bar and restaurant staff all helpful though restaurant service slow. Children were not served food until 1hr 10 mins after sitting down at table.
reviews.title: night before flight from T5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel very modern as you would expect as it is recently opened with still the smell of new carpets (which I heard antoher guest complain about).
reviews.title: Budget Luxury

reviews.text: On arrival found room only made up for 3 people when booked for 2 adults and 2 children. Also found the room to be quite small. I was wondering how they were going to fit a 4th bed in the room and their answer was to place it between the other beds - this left a double and 2 single beds in a row next to each other with no room between them - far from ideal!!
reviews.title: Good for Terminal 5 early departure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After quite a lot of furniture arranging we made finally made ourselves comfortable and had a good stay but this was rather annoyiing. Previous Premier Inn family rooms have been much larger with 2 double beds so this was disappointing.
reviews.title: Great place for a night prior to your flight

reviews.text: New hotel located near the airport. Rooms are quite large, clean and bed is comfy.
reviews.title: Good option near Heathrow

reviews.text: The hotel can be easily reached with the Hoppa coach (8 quid for a return ticket) or local bus #423, takes about 10 minutes to get there.
reviews.title: What a great start to our holiday !

reviews.text: Overall pretty good value for money and kudos for the complimentary tea/coffee in the room- a life saver after a long flight.
reviews.title: Slept brilliantly and a warm welcome from staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally booked the premier inn further away from T5 for £90 but when this came on offer we cancelled that and booked this one. Location was perfect and we got the free bus which picks up and drops off the same place as the hoppa bus so save yourself some money. The bus was the 423. We checked in at 10pm and went straight to the restaurant for tea. Service was slow and this was the same for some previous reviews 45 mins for a burger and pizza but when it arrived it was good ! We booked a family room for 2 adults and 2 kids but the first room only had 3 beds. This was quickly sorted and we were moved to another room. The room was really quiet for being right next to heathrow. Breakfast great would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Clean, close to Terminal 5 and very quiet

reviews.text: This was a brilliant option after a long day and an early flight next day. Desk staff very welcoming and sympathetic to tired travellers. Room immaculate, bed and linen really comfortable. Great power shower in bath and appreciated tea and coffee facilities too. Quiet night's sleep and really easy transfer to T5 via local bus or the Hotel Hoppa service. Well done and keep up the quality.
reviews.title: Premier Inn Terminal 5

reviews.text: A lot of people say that Premier Inn is "cheap 'n' cheerful". And in the most positive sense of the saying, it is! It is cheap, but the quality of rooms, the decor and amenities is like you'd get in much more epensive hotels around Heathrow Airport. And I don't like paying more for less to be honest.
reviews.title: Just like you'd expect from Premier Inn

reviews.text: I stayed here as I had an early flight in the morning. When I arrived, I tried the automated check in system, which was abit of a pain, But I was offered help by a lovely member of the team!
reviews.title: Best Premier Inn I've stayed in

reviews.text: I had booked the meal deal (£22 for dinner and breakfast), so booked a table at the restaurant. The dinner was ok, not at all brilliant, but I was quite hungry. I got the mushrooms (one of them was very cold, almost frozen), the steak (quite tough) and the profiterolls (can't really go wrong with them!). The breakfast is another story tho! I love it and it's one of the reasons I choose to stay at premier inns, it's all you can eat and they have pretty much everything you can wish for, from fresh fruit and cereal to full english breakfast. Yummy!
reviews.title: Good Nights Sleep

reviews.text: The room was lovely, and although my neighbour was banging the cupboards and I could hear it clearly, I did get a good nights sleep. So no money back for me! Room was clean, big and had a sofa which I loved. Also, a brilliant make up mirror! Love it!
reviews.title: Great hotel and value for money

reviews.text: The only negative other than the dinner, whould be the lack of a cash machine. I did want to leave a tip, but as I hadn't brought a lot of cash, I had to save my money for the bus to the airport in the morning. They did have a sash machine, but it was out for order, The nearby one at the McDonalds next door was out of money. Also, a cash machine that charges £1.75 is daylight robbery, and they should look into getting one that charges less! And works, preferably.
reviews.title: Great hotel and staff - can't beat the price

reviews.text: I must admit the idea of staying at Premier Inn did not fill me with great hope, however this stay has completely changed my perception of the brand. On arrival at the hotel, I was warmly greeted by a happy smiling member of staff who took me straight over to the self service check in machine. These machines are excellent confirming your room, taking payment offering add-ons such as breakfast and Wifi at very good rates. Once you make payment it prints your VAT receipt and provides your room key, this is far more efficient than waiting in line at the reception desk. On arrival at my room once again I was very impressed with the quality and cleanliness of the room, it was large and featured a flat screen TV and very comfy bed.
reviews.title: High Quality Hotel Close to T5 - Great Value for Money

reviews.text: The hotel itself has a very pleasant bar and restaurant which is very reasonably priced for Heathrow (you can get a deal including a 3 course evening meal, a beer/glass of wine/soft drink and their full breakfast the next morning for £22 excellent value). The hotel also has a range of reasonably priced vending machines including drinks / snacks / useful travel accessories. I had one of the best night sleep in any hotel at LHR and check out was very easy the next morning just handing your key and room number over to another friendly member of staff on the way out. In conclusion if you are looking for 5 star luxury this is not the place for you, but if you are looking for clean, functional, reasonably priced accommodation with friendly staff close to T5 you cant go wrong. By the way if you want to get to the hotel / terminal for free take the local bus from outside the hotel / terminal 423 which stops at the hotel and is free of charge in apposed to the Hotel hopper which is about £4.50 each way. Do not get in a black cab at T5 it is very expensive for a 5 minute journey - to be avoided at all costs!!!
reviews.title: Excellent stay after aircraft problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Premier Inn near Heathrow's terminal 5 after the aircraft we were flying to India had technical problems and had to return to london and the air company put the family up in this hotel...its probably the finest budget hotel that I have been in. In fact excellent...good beds, good food and its near to a lovely village with good pubs...we were there on a lovely sunny day in May..and it made our stay easier before our long haul flight...and its within walking distance to Terminal 5, but easier with the free London Transport outside the hotel. The Manager and his staff couldn't do enough for us.
reviews.title: Good hotel,but incompetent staff ( some )

reviews.text: We stayed in Premier inn after 24 hour journey from Malaysia. Quick check in, good size and quiet room, comfortable bed, coffee and tea making facility :) That's all we needed after exhausting journey. After we checked out we have realized that we forgot some paintings ( presents from Thailand ) in the room. We contacted the hotel and they were happy and willing to send them to us. 10 days later, no delivery. When we contacted the hotel again, we were told that our paintings are still sitting in the office and we were also questioned if the item was even ours. At the time of the writing my partner is currently on the phone with 3rd person from Premier inn Terminal 5. Let's hope this one will be able to sort this issue out. Better do not forget anything if you stay there!
reviews.title: Nice value hotel. Restaurant needs to step-up!

reviews.text: Really nice value hotel close to the airport.  Very clean, simple setup (couch, desk and bed).  I have been able to check-in early in the morning which I greatly appreciated.
reviews.title: Good, Bad and Ugly

aka: Premier Inn Heathrow Airport Terminal 5 West Drayton, Middlesex
description: Creating a new dining experience in a relaxing environment, the Thyme restaurant and bar provide a range of ‘tasty’ dishes serving both lunch and dinner options. Along with a COSTA coffee store open from 06:30 to 10:30 and our welcoming hotel bar area you will never be short of food and drink options. Not to mention our ‘All You Can Eat’ Full English Buffet Breakfast at only £8.25 per person. At Premier Inn we pride ourselves on comfort and quality. That's why each of our 400 bedrooms has a king sized bed, en-suite bathroom, safety deposit box, tea/coffee making facilities, hairdryer, freeview TV and wifi (at an additional cost). An ideal choice for a business stay, our hotel is conveniently located with great transport links to Heathrow Airport and Central London. For leisure guests, we are ideally located for Heathrow Airport with limited car parking onsite (£12 per night). We also offer a range of park and fly options. We are serviced by the Hoppa to the Terminals, operating from 0425 until 2325 (Terminals 1 and 3) and 0415 to 2345 (Terminal 5) at a cost of £4.50 per person or £8 return. Furthermore we are just 15 miles from both Windsor Castle and Legoland Windsor. Central London is easily accessible by the London Underground stations and the Heathrow Express. With Children (up to the age of 15) eating a free breakfast when accompanied by a full paying adult and no additional charges for family rooms, we are the top choice for families.
